rooms.description: Scandinavian style living room with large windows for natural light and ventilation, integrating a modern split-level design aesthetic.
Open-plan Scandinavian kitchen designed for functionality and efficient use of space, adjoining the dining area.
Dining area integrated with the kitchen, emphasizing natural light through strategically placed windows.
Compact service area for household utilities and storage, designed to maintain a clean aesthetic.
Well-lit corridor connecting the living areas with easy access to other parts of the house.

openings.description: Elegant, minimalistic front door aligning with Scandinavian design principles and Vastu guidelines for auspicious entry.
Efficient garage door designed to allow easy car access while maintaining a sleek exterior.
Large window offering natural light and ventilation, enhancing the ambiance of the living spaces.

rooms.description: Master bedroom with emphasis on privacy, ample natural lighting through large windows adhering to Vastu principles regarding direction.
Second bedroom designed for comfort and efficiency in a Scandinavian style, ensuring proper ventilation and light.
Third bedroom with simple yet functional design, aligning with the overall aesthetic of the house.
Modern bathroom with a minimalistic Scandinavian design, featuring energy-efficient fixtures and natural light from skylights.
Dedicated study space designed for concentration and natural illumination.

openings.description: Interior door connecting the upper floor to the ground floor, ensuring seamless movement between levels.
Strategically placed windows on the upper level for optimal natural light and adherence to Vastu orientation guidelines.

additional_features.budget_considerations: Cost-effective materials and design elements used throughout.
additional_features.vastu_compliance: Orientation and room placements consider traditional Vastu principles, ensuring balance of natural energies.
additional_features.split_level_design: The house utilizes split-level architecture to enhance spatial division while maintaining a cohesive Scandinavian aesthetic.
